COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA
D.C. Resolution 20-249, effective July 10, 2013

20 DCSTAT 2106

A RESOLUTION
To declare the existence of an emergency with respect to the need to amend the Business Improvement
Districts Act of 1996 to update the maximum allowable BID tax due to the Capitol Hill Business
Improvement District.

RESOLVED, BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this
resolution may be cited as the “Capitol Hill Business Improvement District Emergency
Declaration Resolution of 2013”.

Sec. 2. There exists an immediate need to amend the Business Improvement Districts
Act of 1996 to update the maximum allowable BID tax due to the Capitol Hill Business
Improvement District and to ensure the amendment takes effect before the next date upon which
the BID tax is due for remittance.
Sec. 3. The Council of the District of Columbia determines that the circumstances
enumerated in section 2 constitute emergency circumstances making it necessary that the
Capitol Hill Business Improvement District Emergency Amendment Act of 2013 be adopted
after a single reading.
Sec. 4. This resolution shall take effect immediately.
